intro: Melanthium graminifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf meadowbeauty, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow-green flowers arranged in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems and a subject of study in ecological botany.
